description: From scientific Latin babyroussa (later as specific name), and its source, Malay babi rusa, from babi (“pig”) + rusa (“deer”).

entries.meaning: Any of several mammals in the genus Babyrousa in the pig family Suidae, in which the upper tusk grows upward.
examples: And there are wild pigs, babirusas, with wrinkled skin and impressive upper tusks that instead of growing down, grow up and backwards toward the skull.
